BATH, S.C. - Mr. Jimmie E. Smith , 69, of Bath, beloved husband of the late Lois Marie Cherry Smith , entered into rest on Friday, March 30th, 2012.  Born in and a lifelong resident of Aiken County, he was son of the late Kendrick Marvin and Jewell Lorraine Josey Smith . Jimmy worked at Bath Mill for thirty years, had also worked for Clearwater Finishing Plant and retired from Avondale Mills. He was of the Baptist faith. Jimmie was an avid outdoorsman who lived to hunt and fish. In addition to his parents and wife, family members include his children, the late Joey L. Brown, Bridget B. Sanchez, San Antonio, Linda Brown Deal, Bath and Jimmy K. Smith , (Wendy) Warrenville; siblings, Barry Smith , Bath, Eunice Quakenbush, Warrenville and Laura Smith , PA; thirteen grandchildren and fourteen great-grandchildren.  A graveside service will be held on Sunday, (today) April 1st, 2012, at 1:30 in Langley Cemetery, Langley, with Pastor Chris Williams officiating. Pallbearers will be Roland Sanchez, Jimmy Sanchez, Lester Smith , Gerald Johnson, Stacy Johnson and Bo Quakenbush.  Please contact the family for information on memorial contributions.  Friends may call at the home of Jimmy and Wendy Smith.  Please visit our website to share memories of Jimmie.  The family will greet friends on Sunday, (today) April 1st, 2012, from 10 o'clock until noon at Hatcher Funeral Home & Cremation Service, Langley, SC.

John B. Smith
 
  SANDERSVILLE, Ga. -- John B. Smith, 89, of Sandersville, died in Macon Monday after an extended illness.
  Funeral services will be held Tuesday at 2 p.m. At Pleasant Springs Methodist Church, Rev. Bill Berry, Rev. W.A. Sedgwick, and Rev. T.L. Moody officiating.
  Surviving are four daughters, Mrs. M.C. Tompkins of Warner Robbins, Ga., Mrs. C.A. Price of Savannah, Mrs. Dewey Bellamy of Macon, and Mrs. S.T. Smith of Riddleville; three sons, J.H. Smith and E.P. Smith  of Savannah, and T.A. Smith of Augusta; a brother, J.A. Smith of Davisboro; 22 grandchildren, 39 great-grandchildren and 17 great-great-grandchildren.

John Russell Smith
 
  BATH, S.C. -- John Russell Smith, 68, Bryan Drive, died Friday in Veterans Administration Medical Center, Augusta.
  The funeral will be at 3 p.m. Sunday at Posey's Funeral Home, Langley, with the Revs. Stephen Batts and L.V. Davis officiating.  Burial will be in Sunset Memory Gardens.
  Mr. Smith was a native of Bartow, Ga.  He was a U.S. Army Air Corps veteran of World War II and retired after 47 years from Bath Mill, a Division of United Merchants and Manufacturers.  He was a Methodist.
  Survivors include his wife, Elizabeth Jones Smith; a son, Calvin "Bubba" Smith, Bath; a daughter, Edna Nolan, Goose Creek; and a sister, Bertha Hillman, Bath.
  Pallbearers will be Buddy Cain, Eddie Coon, Earl Carter, Pat Fields, Thomas Parker and Wayne Powell.
  Honorary pallbearers will be Woodrow Josey, Paul Mathis, Murray Bridgers, Robert Hatcher and Jack Williams.
  The family will receive friends at the funeral home from 7 to 9 p.m. Today.
  Friends may call at the residence or funeral home.

SortedNewspaperLinks.Notes: Obtained from Georgia Room at the Augusta-Richmond Public Library
SortedNewspaperLinks.Transcription:
Kendrick M. Smith
 
  BATH, S.C. -- Kendrick M. Smith of Bath died Tuesday at the Aiken County Hospital following an extended illness.
  Funeral services will be held at 5 p.m. Thursday at the Bath Baptist Church with the Rev Sam Shaw and the Rev. A.F. Carter officiating.  Burial will be in Langley cemetery.
  A native of Washington County, Ga., he was a son of James A. Smith of Augusta and the late Mrs. Annie McNeely Smith and had lived in Bath for 38 years.  He was retired from United Merchants and was a member of the Bath Baptist Church.
  Survivors, in addition to his father, include his widow, Mrs. Jewell Josey Smith of Bath; two daughters, Mrs. Stanley Quackenbush, Langley, S.C., and Mrs. Curtis Carnell, Dillsburg, Pa.;  four sons Floyd Smith, Carlisle, PA., Kenneth Smith, Jimmie Smith and Barry Smith, all of Bath; 15 grandchildren; three brothers, Russell Smith, Bath, Bennie Smith, Phenix City, Ala., and Sam Smith, Bartow, Ga.; two half-brothers, Jordan Smith and Willie Smith, both of Augusta; three sisters, Mrs. Lorena Josey, Sandersville, Ga., Mrs Bertha Hillman, Augusta, and Mrs. Lizzie Mae Johnson, Sandersville, and several nieces and nephews.
  Friends may call at Posey Funeral Home in Langley until 4 p.m. Thursday, then at the church.

Mrs. James A. Smith
 
  SANDERSVILLE, Ga. -- Mrs. Leila Price Smith, 74, of Rt. 1, Bartow, died Thursday after a short illness at the Louisville Hospital.
  Mrs. Smith was a lifelong resident of Washington County and a member of Josey's Chapel Baptist Church.
  Survivors include her husband James A. Smith; two sons, Henry J. Smith and Willie C. Smith, both of Augusta; four stepsons, Russell Smith and Kendrick Smith, both of Bath, S.C., Bennie Gainer Smith of Lawton, Okla., and Sam Smith of Bartow; three stepdaughters, Mrs. Lorena Josey of Bath, Mrs. Bertha Hillman and Mrs. Lizzie Mae Johnson, both of Augusta;  a number of grandchildren, and several nieces and nephews.
  Funeral services will be conducted 3 p.m. Saturday at Josey's Chapel near Bartow.  Interment will be in the Churchyard cemetery.

MRS. G. F. HARTLEY
 
  ALAMO, Nov. 17 -- Funeral services for Mrs. G. F. Hartley, 65, were held here Sunday at 2:30 p.m. Mrs. Hartley died early Friday at her daughter's, Mrs. C. F. Stone, in Louisville, where she was visiting Mrs. Stone and some other children.
  The services were held at the First Baptist church here and were conducted by Rev. Thomas E. Moye, Macon, Ga.; the Rev. M. M. Gaddy, Louisville, and the Rev. J. G. Harrison, Dublin.
  Mrs. Hartley is survived by seven children; A.L. Hartley, M. E. Hartley, J.F. Hartley, Mrs. C. F. Stone, Mrs. Earl Gillis, Louisville, Ga.; G. V. Hartley, Thomson, and M. C. Hartley, Alamo; and an adopted daughter, Mrs. Susie Francis Wells, Augusta; three brothers and one sister, C. R. Smith, Taylor Smith, and Mrs. H. L. Josie, Bartow; and G. B. Smith, Milledgeville.
Mrs. Norma Jean Smith, 38, of 428 N. East St., Carlisle, died Saturday at Carlisle Hospital.  She was the wife of Floyd K. Smith.

Mrs. Floyd K. Smith
 
  CARLISLE -- Mrs. Norma Jean Smith, 38, wife of Floyd K. Smith, 428 N. East St. Here, died Saturday at Carlisle Hospital.
  A native of Hauk Run, Pa., she attended Carlisle Baptist Church.
  Other survivors include her mother, Mrs. Mary Lewis Duprey, Carlisle; a son, Donald L. Duprey, also of Carlisle; three brothers, John, George, and Robert Duprey, all of Carlisle, and a sister, Mrs. Sylvia Gallo, Philipsburg.
  Services will be held at 10:30 a.m. Tuesday at the funeral home, 169 W. High St., Carlisle.  The Rev. Warren W. Burnham, pastor of Carlisle Baptist Church, will officiate.  Burial will be in Kutz's Church Cemetery.  Friends may call between 7 and 9 p.m. today at the funeral home.

Mrs. Okella Josey Smith, age 86, of Riddleville died Monday, January 27, 2003. Funeral services will be held on Thursday, at 2 p.m. at the May and Smith Funeral Directors Tennille Chapel with burial in Washington Memorial Park.  Visitation will be held on Wednesday from 6 to 8 p.m. at the May and Smith Tennille Chapel.

O. H. SMITH
 
  Wadley, S.C., April 19 -- The funeral of O.H. Smith, 45, was held from New Hope church, near Davisboro, this afternoon at 3:00 o'clock and the interment followed in the church yard.  Rev. J.M. Hancock and Rev. T.M. Calloway were the officiating ministers.
  Mr. Smith's death occurred at his home at midnight Monday.  He is survived by his wife, one son, Raymond Smith, a sister, Mrs. Frank Sheppard of Bartow, and a brother, Wright Smith of Milledgeville.

Mrs. Eugene Smith
 
  BARTOW, Ga. -- Funeral services for Mrs. Eugene T. (Ruth Josey) Smith, 68, of Bartow, who died Sunday in an Augusta hospital, will be held at 3 p.m. Today at Josey Baptist Church.
  The Revs. Inman Gerald and Dan Overstreet will officiate.  Burial will be in the church cemetery.
  A native of Washington County, Ga., she was a member of Josey Baptist Church.
  Survivors include four daughters, Mrs. Newman Smith and Mrs. Julian Arrington, both of Bartow, Mrs. Clifford Meeks, Augusta, and Mrs. Robert Schroeder, Manitowoc, Wis.; three sons, Josey Smith and Verlyn Smith, both of Bartow, and Lamar Smith, Milledgeville, Ga.; five sisters, Mrs. Herschel Smith, Harrison, Ga., Mrs. Jewell Smith and Mrs. Louise Smith, both of Bath, S.C., Mrs. Turner Smith and Mrs. Stella Seneath, both of Bartow; and three brothers, Zepho Josey, Harris Josey, and Ollis Josey, all of Bartow.
  Pallbearers will be Richard Josey, Wayne Josey, Ronnie Josey, Jerry Josey, Ken Smith, and Barry Smith.
  Friends may call at Smith Funeral Home, Wadley, Ga., until one hour prior to services, then at the church.

Sam Smith
 
  RIDDLEVILLE, Ga. -- Funeral services for Sam Smith, 62, of Riddleville, Ga., who died Tuesday in Talmadge Hospital, Augusta, will be held at 2 p.m. Today at Josey's Chapel Baptist Church near Bartow, Ga.
  The Rev. Inman Jarrell will officiate.  Burial will be in the church Cemetery.
  A member of Josey's Chapel Baptist Church, he was a retired sawmill operator.
  Survivors include his widow, Mrs. Lucille S. Smith; four brothers, Russell Smith, Bath, S.C., B.G. Smith, Pheonix City, Ala., Jordan and Willie Smith, both of Augusta;  three sisters, Mrs. Lorene Josey and Mrs. Bertha Hillman, both of Augusta, and Mrs. Lizzie Mae Johnson, Sandersville, Ga.
  Friends may call at Lang's Chapel, Davisboro, Ga., until 12:30 and then at the church.

SMITH -- Entered into rest at his home near Bartow, Ga., Dec 2, 1964, Mr. Turner S Smith, 80, retired farmer.  Funeral services will be held at 3:30 p.m. Thursday at Josey Baptist Church near Bartow wit the Rev. C.E. Croft officiating.  Interment in churchyard cemetery.  Smith Funeral Home, Wadley, Ga.

Turner Smith
 
  Wadley, Ga. -- Funeral services for Turner S Smith, 80, retired farmer, who died at his home near Bartow, Wednesday morning after an extended illness, will be held at 3:30 p.m. Thursday at Josey Baptist Church near Bartow with the Rev. C. E. [?] officiating.  Burial will be in the church yard cemetery.
  Mr. Smith was the son of the late James B. And Susan Clark Smith.  He was born and lived his entire life in Washington County.  He was a member of Woodmen of the World of the World and a member of New Hope Methodist Church.
  Survivors include his widow, Mrs. Evie Lou Josey Smith, Bartow, [?] Raymond Smith, [?] Fla. And [?].
  The [?] will be at the home of Mr. And Mrs. Zepho Josey.  The body will be at Smith Funeral Home, Wadley, until 2 p.m. Thursday when it will be carried to the church.

Mrs. S. T. Smith Sr.
 
  DAVISBORO, Ga., Feb. 26 -- Mrs. S. T. Smith Sr., 73, wife of the late S. T. Smith Sr., of Davisboro died today at 1:20 a.m., at the Vreem Memorial Hospital in Moultrie, after an extended illness.
  Funeral services will be conducted Sunday afternoon at 3 o'clock from the New Bethel Baptist Church in Sandersville with the Rev A. W. Franklin officiating.  Burial will be in the New Bethel Cemetery.
  The body will be at the Green Gregory Funeral Home in Moultrie until 8 a.m. From where it will be taken to the New Bethel Baptist Church for the service.
  Survivors are seven sons, W. B. Smith and Bernard Smith of Deerfield, Fla., Wade Smith and S. T. Smith Jr., of Davisboro, Herbert Smith of Miami Fla., Seaborn Smith of Portsmouth, Va., and Jack Smith of Bartow, Ga.; two daughters, Mrs. J. R. Simpson and Mrs. Homer May, of Berlin, Ga., four sisters, Mrs. H. M. King of Macon.  Mrs. R. J. Page of Davisboro, Mrs. W. H. Jackson of Harrison, and Mrs. A. J. Green of Milledgeville; 14 grandchildren and five great grandchildren.

SMITH -- Entered ino rest Monday Dec. 7, 1964, Mr. W. T. (Sonny) Smith, of near Bartow, Ga.  Funeral services will be held at 3:30 p.m. Tuesday at Josey Baptist Church near Bartow, with the Rev. Inman Geralds officiating.  Interment will be in the church cemetery.  The body will be at the home of Mr. And Mrs. Zebo Josey until the hour of the services.  Smith Funeral Home, Wadley, Ga.

W.T. Smith
 
  WADLEY, Ga. - W.T. (Sonny) Smith, 55, died unexpectedly at his home near Bartow Monday morning.
  Funeral services will be conducted at 3:30 p.m. Tuesday at Josey Baptist Church near Bartow by the Rev. Inman Geralds.  Burial will be in the church cemetery.

Willie Cohen Smith
 
  Willie Cohen Smith of 1549 Fenwick St., died Thursday in University Hospital Augusta.
  The funeral will be at 3 p.m. Sunday at Josey Chapel, Bartow, with the Rev L.V. Davis officiating.  Burial will be in the church cemetery.
  Mr. Smith was a native of Jefferson County.  He was a retired carpenter.
  Survivors include three sons, Willie C. Smith, Jr., Mobile, Ala., Thomas Y. Smith, Clearwater, S.C., and Dennis J. Smith, Atlanta; a daughter, Mary S Pardue, Trenton, S.C.; a brother, J. Russell Smith, Bath, S.C., and a sister, Bertha Hillman, Bath.
  The family will receive friends at Elliott Sons Funeral Home, Telfair Street.  Friends may call at the church beginning at 2 p.m.

Willie C. Smith
 
  The funeral for Willie Cohen Smith, 1549 Fenwick St., who died Thursday, will be at 3 p.m. Today at Josey Chapel, Bartow, with the Rev L.V. Davis officiating.  Burial will be in the church cemetery.
  Friends may call at the church beginning at 2 p.m. Today.
  Elliott Sons Funeral Home, Telfair Street, is in charge of arrangements.

Daniel M. Speicher
 
  Daniel M. Speicher, aged 77 years, died of cancer of the stomach at his home, 1849 River road, at 11 o'clock this morning.  He had been ailing 17 weeks and was bedfast two weeks.  Deceased was born at Bernville and resided in this city 34 years.  He was employed for 16 years as a laborer at the Carpenter Steel Works.  Besides his widow, Elizabeth (nee Ritz), the following children survive:  William, at home; Candace, wife of Lawrence Moyer, West Reading; Sallie, wife of Ellsworth Swavely, Riverside; Agnes, wife of Frank Becker, Frush Valley.  Deceased was a member of Epler's Lutheran Church.

SPEICHER -- In this city, on the 19th inst., DANIEL SPEICHER, aged 76 years,, 2 months and 19 days.
  The relatives and friends of the family are respectfully invited to attend the funeral, without further notice, from his late residence, 1849 River street, on Monday morning at 9:30 at the house.  Services and interment at Epler's Church.

SortedNewspaperLinks.NewspaperHeading: Death of a young Reading Business Man
SortedNewspaperLinks.Transcription:
Mrs. Elizabeth Speicher
 
  Stricken with grief because of the death of her husband on Wednesday,  Aug 19, Mrs Elizabeth Speicher died at her home, 1842 River road, on Tuesday evening.  Deceased, who had suffered from a brief illness, was aged 66 years, 6 months and 4 days.  The couple were very devoted and the demise of the husband was too much for the wife to bear.  She mourned the loss of her lifemate and it was this grief that caused her fatal illness.
  Mrs. Speicher was a member of Epler's Lutheran Church, St. Bernard Temple, No 16, L.G.E., and Riverside Temple, United Americans.  Deceased is survived by these children:  Mrs. Lawrence Moyer, West Reading; Mrs. Ellsworth Swavely, Riverside; Frank Becker, Frush Valley, and William Speicher, at home.

SPEICHER -- In this city, on the 1st inst., ELIZABETH, widow of Daniel Speicher, aged 66 years, 6 months and 4 days.
  The relatives and friends of the family, also St. Bernard Temple, No 16. L.G.E., and United Americans, Riverside Temple, No 89, are respectfully invited to attend the funeral without further notice from her late residence, 1849 River road, on Saturday at 10 o'clock at the house.  Services and Interment at Epler's Church.

Mrs. Margaret D. Stanley
 
  Mrs. Margaret D. Stanley, 66, widow of S. Carroll Stanley, died early this morning in her home, 1705 Lancaster Ave., Shillington.  She was a member of Covenant Methodist Church.
  Surviving are a son, C. Thurston Stanley, Wyomissing; three daughters; M. Muriel, Helen M. and Carol E., all at home; and a brother, the Rev. Clyde E. Morrisson, of Berrysburg, Dauphin County.
  Arrangements are in charge of T.C. Auman, Inc. local funeral directors.

STANLEY -- On the 3d inst., MARGARET D. (nee Morrison) STANLEY, aged 66 years.
  Services from the Theo. C. Auman, Inc., Funeral Parlors, 247 Penn St., on Tuesday at 1 p.m.  Interment in Charles Evans Cemetery.  Friends may call Monday evening, 7 to 9.

STANLEY -- On the 14th inst., SAMUEL CARROLL STANLEY, aged 68 years.
  Services from the Theo. C. Auman Inc., Funeral Parlors, 247 Penn St. Monday at 1 p.m.  Interment in Charles Evans Cemetery.  Friends may call Sunday evening, 7 to 9.

Samuel C. Stanley
  Samuel Carroll Stanley, 68, died at this home, 305 West Douglass St.  He was a music instructor and an organist for 51 years, having served in the latter capacity at Covenant Methodist Church, this city, for 20 years, and at the Birdsboro Methodist Church.  He was a native of Birdsboro, but lived in Reading for 40 years.  He was a member of Covenant Church and Mystic Star Commandery, 47, Knights of Malta.  His parents were the late William J. and Matilda (Nagle) Stanley.
  Surviving are his widow, Margaret (Morrison); a son, Private Carroll Thurston Stanley, Camp Lee, Va.; three daughters, M. Muriel, Helen M., and Carol E., at home, and a sister Mayme, widow of Frank M. Miller, of Reading.
  Funeral from the parlors of T.C. Auman, Inc., Monday at 1 p.m.  The Rev. Charles J. Miller will officiate.  Interment will be made in Charles Evans Cemetery.

SortedNewspaperLinks.Notes: Sister-in-law of Sallie Steffe Rettgers - Attach to Sallie
SortedNewspaperLinks.Transcription:
Mrs. Raymond Steffe
 
  Services for Mrs. Mary E. Steffe, 79, of 6047 Kingessing Ave., Philadelphia, wife of Raymond Steffe, will be held Thursday at 11 a.m. In the Henninger Funeral Home, the Rev. David P. Heil officiating.
  Mrs. Steffe, who died yesterday in the Philadelphia College of Osteopathy Hospital after being a patient there since Feb. 10, will be buried in the Laureldale Cemetery.
  Born in Reading, a daughter of the late Peter and Sallie (Long) Steve, she was a member of Church of God, Philadelphia.

SortedNewspaperLinks.Notes: Sister-in-law of Sallie Steffe Rettgers - Maiden name was Steve
SortedNewspaperLinks.Transcription:
STEFFE -- In Philadelphia, on the 9th inst., MARY E. (nee Steve), wife of Raymond Steffe, of 6047 Kingessing Ave., Philadelphia, age 79 years.
  The Rev. David P. Heil will officiate at services in the Henninger Funeral Home, 229 N. 5th St. Thursday at 11 a.m.  Interment in Laureldale Cemetery.  Friends may call Thursday from 10 to 11 a.m.  No viewing Wednesday evening.

SortedNewspaperLinks.Notes: Mother of Sallie Steffe wife of Frederick Rettgers
SortedNewspaperLinks.Transcription:
MRS. SALLIE STEFFE
 
Ailing several years, Sallie (Wining), widow of James B. Steffe, died of complications at 5:30 o'clock Sunday morning at the residence of her son-in-law, Frederick E. Rettgers, 1016 Robeson street, aged 66 years.  She had been bedfast six months.  Deceased was a member of Trinity United Evangelical Church.  Her husband, who was a boiler inspector employed at the Reading Company's locomotive shops, died two years ago.  Surviving are four children; Harry Raymond, Louisa and Sallie, wife of Frederick E. Rettgers, with whom she made her home.

[STEFFE] -- In this city, on the 30th inst., SALLIE [â€¦] widow of James B. Steffe, aged 66 years, 4 months, and 23 days.
  Relatives and friends are invited to attend the funeral, without further notice, [â€¦] late residence, 1060 Robeson St.  [â€¦] house Wednesady at 2 p.m.  Interment in Trinity Lutheran Cemetery.

AUGUSTUS A. STEPHAN
 
  Augustus A. Stephan, a lifelong resident of this city and for many years employed at the Mt. Penn Stove Works, died of complications at 5:30 p.m. Wednesday at his home, 253 North Front street, aged 69 years.  Hew as a patternmaker and for 40 years worked at the stove plant.  He was a son of Julia and the late David Stephan.  He was a member of the Reformed denomination and Camp No. 330, P.O.S. Of A.   Surviving are his mother, widow, Rebecca (Morrison), three children, Calvin S., Ethel, wife of Charles Hetrich, and Alma, wife of Hiram Kissinger, all of Reading; five grandchildren, one sister, Mrs. John Kline, Ephrata, and one brother, Lewis Stephan, Reading.

STEPHAN -- In this city, on the 17th inst., AUGUSTUS A. STEPHAN, aged 69 years, 1 month and 10 days.
  Relatives and friends are invited to attend the funeral, without further notice, from his residence, 253 North Front street, on Monday afternoon at 2 o'clock.  Services at the house.  Interment in Laureldale Cemetery.

STEPHAN -- In this city, on the 24th inst., REBECCA R (nee Morrison), widow of Augustus A Stephan.
atted the funeral services without fur-
  Relatives and friends are invited to attend the funeral services, from her late residence, 253 North Front Street, Saturday afternoon at 1 o'clock.  Services at the house.  Interment in Laureldale cemetery.  Friends may call at the residence Friday evening, 7 to 9.

Mrs. Rebecca R. Stephan
 
Rebecca R. (Morrison), widow of Augustus A. Stephan, 80, died at her home, 253 North Front street.  She was a daughter of the late John and Elizabeth (Smith) Stephan, and a member of the Reformed Church.
  Surviving are a son, Calvin F. Stephan, of West Wyomissing; two daughters, Mrs. Charles Hetrich and Mrs Hiram Kissinger; also six grandchildren, on great-grandchild and a brother, George Morrison.
  Funeral Services will be held Saturday at 1 o'clock at the house, the Rev. Paul T Slinghoff officiating.  Interment in Laureldale Cemetery.  The Miller Funeral Home has charge.

SortedNewspaperLinks.Notes: Differing accounts on the date of death not resolved
SortedNewspaperLinks.Transcription:
TAGGART -- On September 10, 1899, SARAH M., wife of Joseph Taggart, aged 59 years, 4 months and 12 days.
  The relatives and friends of the family are respectfully invited to attend the funeral services this Wednesday afternoon at 2 o'clock at her late residence No. 730 North Twentieth street.  Interment at West Laurel Hill Cemetery.

Kathleen Thompson
 
  CHERAW -- Services for Kathleen Thompson, 66, will be held at 11 a.m. Friday at Freedom Baptist Church, with burial in Darlington County Memory Gardens.  The family will receive friends from 7 to 9 tonight at Kistler Funeral Home of Darlington.
  Mrs. Thompson, wife of the late Lonnie M. Thompson, died Wednesday, Jan 19, 1994.  Born in Effingham, she was a former president of the American Legion of Effingham and a member of Freedom Baptist Church.
  Surviving are a son, John Thompson of Hamlet, N.C.; a sister, Eveleen Thompson of Darlington; two grandchildren, and two great grand-children.

Lonnie M. Thompson
 
Darlington
 
  Lonnie Malcolm Thompson, 69, died Friday.
  Born in Marion County, he was a son of the late John McLaurin and Claudia Whaley Thompson.  He served in the Army Air Corps during World War II and was a driver with Continental-Trailways before his retirement.  He was a member of American Legion Post 160 Effingham and Freedom Baptist Church in Darlington.
  Surviving are his widow, Mrs. Kathleen Munn Thompson of Darlington; a son, John M. Thompson of Hamlet, N.C.; and a brother, Jack A. Thompson of Darlington.
  Services will be held at 2 p.m. Sunday in Freedom Baptist Church, with burial in Darlington County Memory Gardens.  The family will receive friends from 7 to 9 p.m. today at Kistler-Holmes Funeral Home.

MRS. MARY E. THORNAL
 
  Mrs. Mary E. Thornal, of Montmorenci, died at the home of her son, Mr. J.C. Thornal, on Saturday, after a lingering illness.  She was 81 years of age.
  Her remains were carried to Timmonsville, her hold home on Sunday, and services were held at the home of her sister-in-law, Mrs. J. I. Thornal that afternoon, at 4 o'clock, and interment made in the family cemetery.
  She is survived by three sons, Messers, Evander and John J., of Charleston; and G.C. Thornal, of Montmorenci; one brother, Wesley Broach, of Florence; and one sister, Mrs. Mary Hanson of Lynchburg.

MRS. MARY THORNAL DIED LAST SATURDAY
 
  Mrs. Mary E. Thornal of Montmorenci died last Saturday at the home of her son, J.J. Thornal, at that place following a long illness.  Mrs. Thornal was in her eighty-first year and is survived by three sons, Evander, John J., and G. C. Thornal, all of Montmorenci; one brother, Wesley Broach of Florence, and one sister, Mrs. Mary Hanson of Lynchburg.  The remains were carried to Timmonsville, the former home of the deceased, for the funeral and interment.

Thomas F. Torpey
 
Thomas F. Torpey, 59, 1017 Oley street, died yesterday in St. Joseph's Hospital.  He was born in Bethel, a son of the late John and Ann (Galagher) Torpey.  He was a member of St. Joseph Catholic Church, St. Peter's Temperance Union, Eagles and the Moose.
  He is survived by this widow, Ida (Miller) Torpey and these step-children:  Mrs. Mary Ringler, Reading; Mrs. Laura Rettgers, Reading; Clarence H Hartenstine, Brentwood, Md.: these brothers and sisters; Michael Torpey, New York; Patrick, Reading; Mrs. Annie Flemming, Penfield, Ill; Elizabeth Torpey, Bethlehem, and five grandchildren.
  Funeral Tuesday at 8:15 a.m. From the home.  Requiem High Mass at 9 a.m. St. Joseph's Catholic Church.  Interment in St. Peter's Catholic cemetery.  In charge of Funeral Director Irvin J. Cramp.

TORPEY -- In this city, on the 25th inst., THOMAS F., husband of Ida (nee Miller) Torpey, aged 59 years, 5 months and 26 days.
  Relatives and friends, also all the organizations of which he was a member, are invited to attend the funeral, without further notice, from the Cramp Funeral home, 839 Washington Street, on Tuesday morning, 8:15, D.S.T.  Requiem High Mass at St. Joseph's Catholic Church, 9 o'clock, D.S.T.  Interment in St. Peter's Catholic Church Cemetery.  Friends may call at the Funeral Home Monday evening, 7 to 9.

WAGONSELLER - On the 15th inst., DAVID WAGONSELLER, in his sixty-seventh year.
  The relatives and friends of the family are respectfully invited to attend the  funeral this morning, at 11 o'clock, from his late residence, Lenni, Delaware county, Pa.  To proceed to Mount Hope Cemetery.
Lydia Walborn, wife of Daniel Walborn, near Carey died May 13th, 1872 of cancer, at the age of 57 years, 3 months, and 10 days.  Funeral by Rev. C. Wernel, in the German and English languages.

WILLIAMS -- In this city, on the 28th inst. MRS. CATHARINE (nee Seivard) WILLIAMS, aged 88 years, 2 months and 18 days.
  Relatives and friends are invited to attend the funeral without further notice, from her late residence, at Warwick, Chester Co., on Thursday Feb 1 at 120.  Services at the house.  Interment in St. Mary's Presbyterian Church cemetery, Warwick, PA.

DIES WHILE ON VISIT
 
  While on a visit to Reading, Mrs. Catharine Williams, whose sister, Mrs. Elizabeth Hartenstine, preceded her in death four weeks in Baltimore, Md., died of pneumonia early today at the home of her son-in-law, Charles E. Cosgrave, 237 West Oley street.  She attained the advanced age of 88 years, 2 months and 18 days.  Her home was in Warwick, Chester county.  She came to Reading eight weeks ago to visit her daughter and son-in-law and contracted the fatal disease on Saturday.  She was the widow of Wil- [â€¦] Williams who died 39 years ago.  She was born in Warwick, a [â€¦] and Catharine Seivard.  Deceased was a member of the Baptist Church.  These children survive:  Margaret, wife of Lewis Hartenstine, Pine Swamp, Chester county; Catharine, wife of John Wilson, Elverson; Ella, wife of Luther Shingle, Birdsboro; Eliza-  [â€¦] at whose home she passed away; [â€¦] of Warwick.  Sixteen grand and 27 great-grandchildren, a sister, Mrs. Mary Hartenstine, of Wilmington, Del., and a brother, Harry, of this city, also remain.

WILSON -- In this city, on the 14th inst., Helen Esther (nee Bechtel) wife of Raymond Wilson, aged 37 years, 3 months, 20 days.
  Relatives and friends are invited to attend the funeral, without further notice, from the residence of her parents, Mr. And Mrs. John H. Bechtel, 229 W. Greenwich St., Thursday at 11:00 a.m.  Services at the house.  Interment in Chas. Evans cemetery.

MRS. RAYMOND WILSON, dauther of Mr. And Mrs. John H. Bechtel, 229 W. Greenwich St., this city, died suddenly yesterday in her home at Oaklyn, N.J.  Besides her husband, she is survived by six children, John, Esther, Ruth, Catharine, George, and Marie.

VISITOR DIES HERE
 
  While in Reading on a visit, Mrs Minnie R. Wilson, aged 42 years, died following several operations for complications at 12 o'clock noon today at the home of her sister, Mrs. John H. Bechtel, 229 West Greenwich street.  Mrs. Wilson came here three weeks ago from Schenectady, N.Y., her home, to visit her sister.
  Deceased was born in Reading where she lived until 14 years ago, when she took up residence in Schenectady.  Her parents were Enoch and Helen (nee Ritz) Savage of Schenectady.  While living here Mrs Wilson was a member of Grace (Alsace) Reformed congregation.  She leaves her parents, one son, Leo, and three sisters: Mrs. John H. Bechtel and Mrs. Peter Miller, Reading, and Mrs. Florence Millmore, Schenectady.

WILSON -- In this city, on the 5th inst., MRS MINNIE R. (nee Savage) WILSON, aged 42 years, 7 months and 23 days.
  Relatives and friends are invited to attend the funeral without further notice from the residence of her brother-in-law, John H Bechtel, 229 West Geenwich St., Monday at 2 p.m.  Services at the house.  Interment in Charles Evans Cemetery.

Mrs. Minnie R. Wilson
 
  Relatives and friends attended the funeral of Mrs. Minnie R (nee Savage) Wilson, held from the home of her brother-in-law, John H Bechtel, 229 West Greenwich street.  The services were held at the house with Rev. G.R. Poetter in charge.  The body was dressed in silk and rested in a solid mahogany casket.  Undertaker Seidel directed interment which followed in Charles Evans Cemetery.

WILSON -- In Manahawkin, New Jersey, on the 27th inst., RAYMOND E WILSON of 15 Beacon Drive, Loveladies, New Jersey age 90 years.
  Services from Trinity Lutheran Church, 6th & Washington Sts.  Reading, Thursday 11 a.m.  Interment Charles Evans Cemetery.  Friends may call Wednesday evening 7 to 9 at the Henninger Funeral Home, 229 N 5th St.

Raymond E. Wilson
 
  Services for Raymond E. Wilson, 90, of 15 Beacon Drive, Loveladies, N.J. will be held Thursday at 11 a.m.
  The Rev. Elton P Richards Jr. Will officiate in Trinity Lutheran Church.  Burial will be made in the Charles Evans Cemetery.  The Henninger Funeral Home has charge.
  Mr. Wilson died Monday morning in the Southern Ocean County Memorial Hospital, Manahawkin, N.J. Where he was a patient since Friday.
  Born in Reading, he was a son of the late George C. and Lydia A. (Noll) Wilson.
  Mr. Wilson had been an electrical engineer before retiring in 1957.
  Surviving are four daughters:  Helen E., widow of Joseph L. Williams, Loveladies, and Ruth E. Wife of Edgar L Holzer, Woodbury N.J., Mrs. Catharine E Barnes, Burlington, N.J. And Mrs. Marie E McCloskey, Cherry Hill, N.J.  14 grandchildren, and 19 great-grandchildren.

Mrs. Clara Winter
 
After a brief illness, Mrs. Clara Winter (nee Lebo), of 534 South Fourteenth Street, died of heart failure early Friday evening, aged 56 years.  She was ailing about two weeks.  Deceased, who was the widow of Henry K Winter, was born at Myerstown.   She resided in this city nearly 50 years.  There remain the following children:  Bertha, wife of William Kiefer; Minnie, wife of Elmer Foreman, Harry L., J Eduard and Walter Winter.  Deceased is also survived by these brothers and sisters:  Willis and John Lebo, Sallie, wife of Henry Hageman, Katie, wife of John Fett, all of this city, and William Lebo of Altooona.  Mrs. Winter was a member of the Friendship Home Mission.

WINTER -- In this city, on the 11th inst., CLARA, widow of Henry K. Winter, aged 56 years and 23 days.
  The relatives and friends of the family are respectfully invited to attend the funeral without further notice, from her late residence, 534 South 14th street, on Wednesday at 1:30 p.m.  Services at Friendship Home Mission, Cotton street near 10th. at 2 p.m.  Interment at Trinity Lutheran cemetery.

HENRY K. WINTER
 
  Henry K. Winter died of paralysis of the heart yesterday morning, at his residence, 534 South Fourteenth Street, aged 53 years.  Deceased was a lifelong resident of his city and was employed as a boilermaker at the Scott Works.  He is survived by the following children:  Mrs. William Kieffer, Harry T., Edward, Mrs. Emma Foreman and Walter.

JOHN M. WISE, SR.
  WAYCROSS, Ga., July 24. -- John M. Wise, Sr., 86, veteran of the War Between the States, died at his home in Jamestown, four miles northwest of Waycross yesterday following an extended illness.  The Confederate veteran has lived in Waycross for 22 years, during which time he has been engaged in the market business.
  He is survived by his wife, two sons, John M Wise, Jr., and A.J. Wise, both of Waycross, and one daughter, Mrs. J.E. McKissick, of Hyman, S.C., also one brother, Joseph Wise of Hannah, S.C., and three sisters, Mrs. W.A. Powell and Mrs. William Abrons, of Johnsonville, S.C., and Mrs. Matha Poston, of Hannah, S.C.
  Funeral services were held this morning, services being conducted by the Rev. S.P. Clary, pastor of the Hebardville Methodist church.  Interment was at Kettle Creek cemetery.

DEATH OF SAMUEL WYNN, SR.
 
  Samuel Wynn, Sr., a respected citizen of Joanna Station, this county, died on Saturday afternoon after a lingering illness, aged 78 years, leaving a large circle of relatives and acquaintances.  The interment will take place at Harmony M.E. Burying ground, in Caernarvon township.

Caroline, widow of Wm. H. Zerbe, aged 62 years, 5 months and 17 days, died of jaundice and liver complaint to-day, at 2:35 a.m. At the residence of her son, Oliver Zerbe, 134 Chestnut.  The remains were removed by Undertaker Hunter Henninger to the residence of her son-in-law, Benj. Focht, 39 South 2d.  Deceased had been ailing since Christmas and was bedfast since that time.  She was born at Millersburg, and was a daughter of Geo. And Eva Lightner, both deceased.  She resided in Reading for 23 years.  She was a member of Salem Reformed church, of Millersburg,.  Her husband died 2 years ago.  Four children, Oliver W., Rilla J., wife of Benj. Focht, Geo. L. and Emma L., are residing in Reading, and these brothers and sisters: Percival Zerbe, Reading; Frank Lightner, Richland, Lebanon County; Mrs. Wm. Lebo, Reading; Mrs. Clementine Lease, Newport, Perry county, and Mrs. Daniel Holtzman, of Millersburg, survive.

ZERBE -- In this city, on the 31 inst., MRS WILLIAM ZERBE, aged 62 years, 5 months and 11 days.
  Relatives and friends of the family are respectfully invited to attend the funeral without further notice, from the residence of her son-in-law, Benjamin Focht, 39 South 2d. St. On Saturday afternoon at 2 o'clock.  Services at the house.  Interment at Trinity Lutheran cemetery.

Death of Doctor Zerbe
 
  The announcement of the death of Dr. Jonathan Zerbe, of Shaefferstown, which took place last night at 10:16 o'clock p.m., yesterday, will be received throughout the county with more than ordinary degree of sorrow.  Dr. Zerbe has been ailing for some time past from cancer of the stomach, which fatal malady ended his career among men.  He was known as among the most prominent men in our county, and possessed the confidence of the people as few men do.
  Born in Berks county in 1812, he grew up a devotee to the science of medicine which study he prosecuted with great success, graduating in the year 1837.  On finishing his medical studies he located himself in Shaefferstown, where he practiced his profession ever since -- a period of about 40 years.  In 1861 he was an independent candidate for the State Senate, running against Amos R. Boughter, Esq.  At a later period he was elected by the people of Lebanon county to the Pennsylvania House of Representatives, and the year following he declined a second election.  Last fall his name was before the Republican County Convention for nomination again for the legislature, and came within one of receiving the nomination.
  His influence as a citizen and politicians was not to be despised, being felt in every section of the country.  His funeral will take place in Shaefferstown on Sunday morning next.

ZERBE -- In this city, on the 6th inst., PERCIVAL ZERBE, aged 83 years, 2 months and 21 days.
  The relatives and friends are invited to attend the funeral, without further notice, from the residence of his son-in-law, Jonathan R Sherman, 1026 North 4th Street, Wednesday, Nov. 10, at 2 p.m. with services at the house only.  Interment in Charles Evans Cemetery.

Percival Zerbe
 
  Percival Zerbe died from infirmities at the home of his son-in-law, Jonathan R. Sharman, 1024 North 4th street, Saturday morning at 9 o'clock.  He was aged 85 years and had been [1] one week.
  He is survived by two daughters, Mrs. John Newcomet and Mrs. Jonathan R. Sharman, both of this city, also four grandchildren.

SARAH A. (Clemmens) ZERBE, 96, widow of Percival Zerbe, died in the Reading hospital.  There survives one daughter, Alice, widow of Jonathan Sharman, 1024 N. Fourth st., with whom Mrs. Zerbe resided.  Mrs. Zerbe was a member of the Lutheran denomination.
  Funeral Friday at 2 p.m. From the home of her daughter.  Interment in charge of Funeral Director F.F. Seidel.

ZERBE -- In this city, on the 19th inst., Sarah (nee Clemmens), widow of Percival Zerbe, of 1024 N. Fourth St., aged 96 years, 9 months and 13 days.
  Relatives and friends are invited to attend the funeral services, without further notice, from F. F. Seidel's Funeral Chapel, 117 N. Fifth St., Friday at 1:30.  Interment in Charles Evans Cemetery.  Friends may call at the Seidel Funeral Home on Thursday evening.

SortedNewspaperLinks.NewspaperHeading: Sudden Death of Wm H Zerbe
SortedNewspaperLinks.Transcription:
SUDDEN DEATH OF WM. H. ZERBE
 
A Well-Known Business Man Who Was a Californian Pioneer - Other Deaths
 
  William H. Zerbe, 1160 Perkiomen avenue, died suddenly Sunday night at 11 o'clock while walking about in his room.  He was in the employ of Isaac W. Keim, liquor dealer, Sixth and Washington Streets, and had been associated with him for the past three years.  Probably no business man in this city had a more extensive acquaintance and there was certainly no one more universally liked.  He was a trusted employee and his personal integrity was unquestioned.  He left the store on Saturday in the best of humor and had arranged for this morning's work.  He had expected to attend the funeral of Mr. Keim's mother on Wednesday, and during their latter days the two had exhibited a special solicitude for each other's welfare.  He was born in Schaefferstown, Lebanon county, and led a venturesome live in his early days, having joined the 49ers in California, made the trip overland and rounded Cape Horn.  He had visited South American countries, and during the late was an atachee of the provost marshal's office in this city.  In whatever live of duty he found himself he was honest and faithful and he won the commendation and respect of all who knew him.  He was 70 years old and leaves a widow and four children; Mrs. Benjamin Focht, 402 Rosenthal street; Miss Annie and George and Oliver, besides thirteen grandchildren.

ZERBE -- In this city, on the 11th inst., Wm. H. Zerbe, aged 69 years, 6 months and 11 days.
  The relatives and friends of the family are respectfully invited to attend the funeral without further notice, from his late residence, 1160 Perkiomen Ave., on Saturday, Feb 17, 1894, at 1:30 p.m.  Services at the house.  Interment at Trinity Lutheran Cemetery.

Wm. H. Zerbe died of heart disease Sunday night, at his residence, 1160 Perkiomen Ave.  He was in good spirits and apparently in the best of health all of Sunday, but shortly after retiring  he was seized with a coughing spell.  His wife went to his assistance and asked him what she could do for him, when he remarked, "It's all over, " and he requested that his son, Oliver W., be sent for.  Mr. Zerbe died shortly after.  He was born in  the vicinity of Millersburg and led a venturesome life in his early days having joined the 49ers in California, made the trip overland and rounded Cap Horn.  He visited South American countries, and during the late war was an attachee of the provost marshal's office in this city.  Before the war he was clerk at Mishler's hotel where the Central house now stands, and later held the same position at the Lititz Springs hotel.  For the past 13 years he was in the employ of Isaac W Keim, liquor dealor.  He was 69 years of age, had an extensive acquaintance, and was well liked.  His wife and 4 children; Mrs. Benj Focht, Miss Emma L., George L. and Oliver W., besides 13 grandchildren, survive.  Mrs. Wm. Lebo and Percival Zerbe, both of this city, are sister and brother.

Stanley-Morrison

Samuel Carroll Stanley, son of William J. and Matilda Stanley, 209 Franklin street, and Margaret B. Morrison, 747 North Eight street, will be married this evening.
Samuel Carroll Stanley, 209 Franklin street, and Margaret B. Morrison, 747 North Eighth street, were married last evening.
Edgar S. Morrison, driller, son of Ithman and Clara Morrison, 1043 Greenwich, and Minnie T., daughter of Wm. Werner, Birdsboro.
